New Records: Jeffrey Vandersay took 6 wickets in an ODI, leading Sri Lanka to a 32-run win over India
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma top scored with 64 runs for India
Jeffrey Vandersay snapped Rohit up to start India's collapse
Washington Sundar's three wicket-haul helped India to restrict Sri Lanka to 240/9 from 50 overs
Virat Kohli was dismissed LBW by Vandersay
Shreyas Iyer was dismissed LBW by Vandersay
KL Rahul was dismissed by Vandersay
Shubman Gill was dismissed by Vandersay
Shivam Dube was dismissed by Vandersay
Axar Patel was dismissed by Asalanka
Rohit Sharma was dismissed by Vandersay
Pre-Game Insights: Washington Sundar said that the pitch had some bounce and turn, and India's spinners did well to restrict Sri Lanka to 240/9
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma said that India failed to play consistent cricket and lost the game
Jeffrey Vandersay said that he was under pressure coming into the team, but took credit for his performance and gave credit to the Sri Lankan batters
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo, Sri Lanka
The weather conditions were favorable for the match
The pitch had some bounce and turn, which made it challenging for the batsmen
The match was a crucial one for Sri Lanka, as they took a 1-0 lead in the series
